captions.text: The Fear of Knowing Oneself                  Satyam, Shivam, Sunderam #16
My talking to you has not the ordinary purpose that talking serves: indoctrination -- that is not the purpose of my talks.
I don't have any doctrine; my talking is really a process of dehypnosis.
Just listening to me, slowly, slowly you will be free of all the programs that the society has forced you to believe in."
Why am I always running so fast?
Is there something that I don't want to see?
you cannot run away from yourself.
It is the greatest fear in the world.
It is because you have been
that you have become afraid of yourself.
That idea has sunk very deep into your unconscious
Naturally, the best way is to get away from yourself.
Everybody is doing it in different ways:
But if you look deep down,
they are not running for anything, they are running from.

title: OSHO: The Fear of Knowing Oneself (Preview)

comments.text: Simple: Aceptación﻿
comments.author: Gianinna Andrea

comments.text:
There are two selves. One is true, the other false. The false self is the 
ego, which is identification with a separate body, mind, soul. The real 
self is the presence, in which everything occurs - all bodies, minds, 
souls. The ego is a "thing" amongst many other things. The true self is the 
presence (not a thing) in which all things occur. Revealing the true self 
is the end of the false self. It is only natural that the ego (false self) 
fears its own death.
comments.author: Atanas Gunchev

he is saying that everyone is trying to run from themselves, he is not

comments.text:
Try to imagine everyone you see as a part of yourself, or you a part of 
them. Then keep extending that thought until the whole world is a part of 
you, a singularity. Also don't judge yourself by your successes, be happy 
that you're trying and that are on the right path; whatever it may be.

comments.text:
Perhaps in our ordinary lives we clash with a lot of feelings we don't 
wanna feel. We think what we feel, and yet we feel what we think... and 
what we are is that. It always changes... We wanna identify ourselves with 
the good feelings, but often it gets worse trying to control it... the way 
to competence gets unclear and usually we try to get a satisfaction from 
somewhere do get some joy to bury the bad feelings... .If we were slaves 
for 15 years, and now finally free- we wont give a fuck :D
comments.author: hunsag tao

comments.text:
a good exorcize to lose yourself is to gaze in the mirror a few feet away 
and look into your eyes and empty your mind.don't be afraid if it seems 
like another entity is watching,because its only yourself... as there are 
two different optical pathways to different parts of the brain. one goes to 
your vision part,the other to where you tell distance and space. it is very 
affective(and free)
